./PX Annex 02 - Information To Be Suppli.description: This requirement involves providing essential information about the medical device, including the product or trade name, any alternative identifiers, a general description of the device and its intended purpose, as well as identifying the intended users and any necessary training for safe use.

sub_requirements.description: Clearly state the product or trade name as it will appear on the market.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Check if the product or trade name is explicitly stated in the documentation. It should match the name that will be used in marketing and distribution. If the name is missing or does not match, it is non-compliant. If the name is present but unclear, it is partly compliant. If the name is not applicable (e.g., for prototypes), mark it as non-applicable.

sub_requirements.description: Include any alternative names or identifiers used in marketing or distribution.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Verify if alternative names or identifiers are listed. If they are present and correctly referenced, it is compliant. If they are missing or incorrect, it is non-compliant. If the device does not have alternative names, it is non-applicable.

sub_requirements.description: Provide a concise general description of the device, including its intended purpose.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Ensure the general description of the device is provided and includes its intended purpose. If the description is comprehensive and clear, it is compliant. If the description is vague or incomplete, it is partly compliant. If no description is provided, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: Identify the intended users (e.g., healthcare professionals, patients) and any specific training required for use.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Check if the intended users are identified and if any specific training requirements are mentioned. If both are clearly stated, it is compliant. If either the users or the training requirements are missing or unclear, it is partly compliant. If neither is provided, it is non-compliant.

./PX Annex 10 - Existing Approvals and C.description: This requirement ensures the assignment and documentation of the Basic UDI-DI in compliance with MDR standards, including the format, structure, issuing agency, and any additional identifiers that support traceability.

sub_requirements.description: Assign the Basic UDI-DI in accordance with the requirements of Part C of Annex VI.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Verify that the Basic UDI-DI is assigned according to the following criteria: it must be unique to the device model, issued by an accredited issuing agency, and follow the format and structure specified in Part C of Annex VI. Check if the UDI-DI includes a device identifier (DI) and a production identifier (PI). If all criteria are met, it is compliant. If some criteria are not fully met, it is partly compliant. If the UDI-DI is missing or does not follow the required format, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: Provide the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Check if the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI are provided and match the specifications in Part C of Annex VI. The UDI-DI should include both a device identifier (DI) and a production identifier (PI). If the format and structure are correct, it is compliant. If there are minor deviations, it is partly compliant. If the format and structure are missing or incorrect, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: Include the issuing agency for the UDI and any relevant registration numbers.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Ensure that the issuing agency for the UDI is included, along with any relevant registration numbers. The issuing agency must be accredited and recognized. If the issuing agency and registration numbers are correctly provided, it is compliant. If either is missing or incorrect, it is partly compliant. If neither is provided, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: If applicable, provide a clear identification by means of product code, catalogue number, or other unambiguous references that allow traceability.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Check for the presence of product codes, catalogue numbers, or other unambiguous references that allow traceability. These identifiers should be clear and match the device documentation. If all identifiers are present and clear, it is compliant. If some identifiers are missing or unclear, it is partly compliant. If not applicable, mark it as non-applicable. If missing, it is non-compliant.

./PX Annex 04 - General Safety And Perfo.detailed_compliance_explanation: The current documentation related to Unique Device Identification (UDI) demonstrates partial compliance with MDR requirements. Although the Basic UDI-DI is alluded to, the documentation does not explicitly define its assignment in accordance with the specified format and structure outlined in Annex VI. For instance, it fails to distinctively indicate how the Basic UDI-DI is linked to the Device Identifier (DI) and Production Identifier (PI), both of which are critical for ensuring effective traceability. A thorough compliance would require an explicit declaration of the Basic UDI-DI, encompassing specifications such as device model, alongside clear descriptions of its relation to both the DI and PI, which is currently inadequately addressed. Moreover, while an issuing agency is noted, the lack of documented proof of its recognition and accreditation raises substantial concerns regarding the credibility of the assigned UDI. Hence, fundamental deficiencies preclude a full compliance designation, though some measures point towards a step in the right direction.

sub_requirements.description: Assign the Basic UDI-DI in accordance with the requirements of Part C of Annex VI.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The documentation refers to the Basic UDI-DI but lacks complete details as mandated by Part C of Annex VI. The required structure and format are not fully met, as the Basic UDI-DI ought to uniquely identify the device model and clarify its connections to the Device Identifier (DI) and Production Identifier (PI). An example of compliant documentation would clearly delineate the Basic UDI-DI and articulate the relationships with DI and PI, ensuring interoperability among identifiers. As the current documents fail to provide these definitions and relationships, the assessment remains partly compliant.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Verify that the Basic UDI-DI is assigned according to the following criteria: it must be unique to the device model, issued by an accredited issuing agency, and follow the format and structure specified in Part C of Annex VI. Check if the UDI-DI includes a device identifier (DI) and a production identifier (PI). If all criteria are met, it is compliant. If some criteria are not fully met, it is partly compliant. If the UDI-DI is missing or does not follow the required format, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: Provide the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The documentation is deficient in providing necessary details pertaining to the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI, aspects that are integral as mandated by Annex VI of the MDR. This annex is explicit in requiring both the Device Identifier (DI) and the Production Identifier (PI) to be components of the Basic UDI-DI, complete with a thorough elucidation of how these elements should be represented. A compliant submission would stipulate the exact format utilized for the UDI-DI and clarify its relation to both DI and PI. The absence of this fundamental information leads to a classification of non-compliance.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Check if the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI are provided and match the specifications in Part C of Annex VI. The UDI-DI should include both a device identifier (DI) and a production identifier (PI). If the format and structure are correct, it is compliant. If there are minor deviations, it is partly compliant. If the format and structure are missing or incorrect, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: Include the issuing agency for the UDI and any relevant registration numbers.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: While the documentation contains a reference to the issuing agency responsible for the UDI, it lacks comprehensive details and supporting registration numbers that would validate the agency's accreditation status. For instance, if GS1 is specified as the issuing agency, additional supporting documentation such as a certification confirming its UDI-accreditation should be presented. The absence of such verification undermines the credibility of the UDI assignment and results in a partly compliant classification due to inadequate credentialing.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Ensure that the issuing agency for the UDI is included, along with any relevant registration numbers. The issuing agency must be accredited and recognized. If the issuing agency and registration numbers are correctly provided, it is compliant. If either is missing or incorrect, it is partly compliant. If neither is provided, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: If applicable, provide a clear identification by means of product code, catalogue number, or other unambiguous references that allow traceability.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The documentation fails to provide any identifying references such as product codes or catalogue numbers that are crucial for establishing a direct link to the medical device itself. This lack of essential information severely undermines compliance with the traceability requirements dictated by the MDR. Adequate documentation should explicitly reference product codes or catalogue numbers correlated with the device to facilitate efficient identification and recall processes. The absence of these identifiers leads to a classification of non-compliance, as it directly conflicts with essential traceability expectations.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Check for the presence of product codes, catalogue numbers, or other unambiguous references that allow traceability. These identifiers should be clear and match the device documentation. If all identifiers are present and clear, it is compliant. If some identifiers are missing or unclear, it is partly compliant. If not applicable, mark it as non-applicable. If missing, it is non-compliant.

./PX Annex 04 - General Safety And Perfo.description: This requirement ensures the assignment and documentation of the Basic UDI-DI in compliance with MDR standards, including the format, structure, issuing agency, and any additional identifiers that support traceability.

./PX Annex 04 - General Safety And Perfo.detailed_compliance_explanation: The technical documentation confirms that the paragitPX device has been assigned a Basic UDI-DI, which meets the requirements laid out in MDR Annex II, Section 1.1(b)[2]. Specifically, the Basic UDI-DI is issued by a recognized accredited agency, ensuring its uniqueness to the specific model in question. Documentation includes a comprehensive format that adheres to Part C of Annex VI of the MDR, which necessitates the presence of a device identifier (DI) and a production identifier (PI) within the UDI, thereby adequately supporting traceability as mandated in the regulation. For instance, an excerpt from the documentation provides the UDI-DI example, demonstrating its structure and compliance with the identifiable qualities needed for traceability as outlined by the regulation.

sub_requirements.description: Assign the Basic UDI-DI in accordance with the requirements of Part C of Annex VI.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The assignment of the Basic UDI-DI has been confirmed to align with Part C of Annex VI of the MDR. The relevant documentation indicates that the Basic UDI-DI is unique to the paragitPX model and is assigned by an accredited agency, reaffirming adherence to the statutory requirements. Specifically, the documentation articulates the unique characteristics of the UDI-DI, confirming compliance with the requisite criteria that it must include a device identifier (DI) and a production identifier (PI). Hence, this aspect is fully compliant with the MDR.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Verify that the Basic UDI-DI is assigned according to the following criteria: it must be unique to the device model, issued by an accredited issuing agency, and follow the format and structure specified in Part C of Annex VI. Check if the UDI-DI includes a device identifier (DI) and a production identifier (PI). If all criteria are met, it is compliant. If some criteria are not fully met, it is partly compliant. If the UDI-DI is missing or does not follow the required format, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: Provide the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The documentation effectively outlines the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI, aligning with the specifications laid out in Part C of Annex VI. It explicitly delineates both the device identifier and production identifier components that are integral to the UDI format. For example, the specified structure includes an alphanumeric string that accurately demarcates the identifiers, confirming regulatory compliance. This clarity validates that the format adheres directly to the expected guidelines.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Check if the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI are provided and match the specifications in Part C of Annex VI. The UDI-DI should include both a device identifier (DI) and a production identifier (PI). If the format and structure are correct, it is compliant. If there are minor deviations, it is partly compliant. If the format and structure are missing or incorrect, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: Include the issuing agency for the UDI and any relevant registration numbers.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The technical documentation successfully contains the details of the issuing agency for the UDI, including its official registration numbers, as required by the MDR. The issuing agency has been validated as accredited, reflecting compliance with the relevant regulatory standards. This inclusion promotes transparency and enhances traceability—both critical components of regulatory adherence.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Ensure that the issuing agency for the UDI is included, along with any relevant registration numbers. The issuing agency must be accredited and recognized. If the issuing agency and registration numbers are correctly provided, it is compliant. If either is missing or incorrect, it is partly compliant. If neither is provided, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: If applicable, provide a clear identification by means of product code, catalogue number, or other unambiguous references that allow traceability.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The technical documentation clearly presents product codes and catalogue numbers enabling the clear traceability of the paragitPX device, thereby fulfilling the traceability requirement as outlined by the MDR. These identifiers are distinctly stated in the accompanying documentation, eliminating any ambiguity about the product referenced. For instance, the unique product codes correlate directly with the UDI-DI, reinforcing both traceability compliance and regulatory obligations.
sub_requirements.assessment_criteria: Check for the presence of product codes, catalogue numbers, or other unambiguous references that allow traceability. These identifiers should be clear and match the device documentation. If all identifiers are present and clear, it is compliant. If some identifiers are missing or unclear, it is partly compliant. If not applicable, mark it as non-applicable. If missing, it is non-compliant.

./PX Annex 08 - EU Declaration of Confor.detailed_compliance_explanation: The Basic UDI-DI is clearly assigned as '574400503ParagitPX6B' in the EU Declaration of Conformity. This UDI follows the format requirements specified in MDR Annex VI, reflecting the necessary structure and ensuring it is unique to the device model. The UI-DI encompasses both the device identifier (DI) and the production identifier (PI), which are essential for traceability as mandated by MDR. Upon thorough review, all established criteria outlining the requirements for compliance with UDI specifications have been met.

sub_requirements.description: Assign the Basic UDI-DI in accordance with the requirements of Part C of Annex VI.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The Basic UDI-DI '574400503ParagitPX6B' is assigned in conformity with the criteria of Part C of Annex VI of the MDR. It is unique to the model and issued by an accredited issuing agency, evidenced by the accompanying GS1 Company prefix document. This UDI-DI conforms to the necessary format and structure requirements set out in the regulations. Specifically, it integrates the device identifier (DI) and relevant production identifiers (PI), fulfilling all the assessment criteria for this sub-requirement.

If the UDI-DI is missing or does not follow the required format, it is non-compliant.

sub_requirements.description: Provide the format and structure of the Basic UDI-DI.

This structure aligns with the requirements in Part C of Annex VI, which mandates the inclusion of both a device identifier and a production identifier. There are no discrepancies noted, and the provided UDI-DI adheres to all relevant standards, thereby ensuring full compliance within this criterion.

sub_requirements.description: Include the issuing agency for the UDI and any relevant registration numbers.

This confirms the UDI-DI '574400503ParagitPX6B' was issued by an accredited agency, and relevant registration numbers can be verified against recognized UDI issuers. sub_requirements.description: If applicable, provide a clear identification by means of product code, catalogue number, or other unambiguous references that allow traceability.
sub_requirements.detailed_compliance_explanation: The EU Declaration of Conformity includes the EMDN Code 'Z12100401', which serves as a clear identifier to enhance product traceability. This complies with the MDR requirements ensuring that medical devices can be accurately tracked and traced throughout their lifecycle. The EMDN Code provides the necessary clarity in identification, thus contributing positively to overall compliance.
